sub_topic: Probability of a certain type of technological failure occurring in a system
message_1: A company uses a system of 10 components, each with a probability of failure of 0.05. What is the probability that at least one of the components will fail?
message_2:
To find the probability that at least one component will fail, it's easier to find the probability that none of the components will fail and then subtract that from 1.

The probability that a single component will not fail is 1 - 0.05 = 0.95.

Since there are 10 components, the probability that all of them will not fail is (0.95)^10.

Now, we can find the probability that at least one component will fail:

P(at least one failure) = 1 - P(no failures)
P(at least one failure) = 1 - (0.95)^10

Calculating (0.95)^10:
(0.95)^10 ≈ 0.5987369

Now, subtract that from 1:
P(at least one failure) = 1 - 0.5987369
P(at least one failure) ≈ 0.4012631

So, the probability that at least one of the components will fail is approximately 0.4013 or 40.13%.
